Headless Slurm Runs OverviewÔÉÅ

Purpose

A few optimizations and modifications are provided in order to have a smooth running of CLEDB on headless systems like research computing clusters. The Slurm environment is utilized.

Namely:

  • Instructions for resource allocation, installing, and running the inversion in both interactive and batch modes of Slurm research computing setups are provided.

  • The database building bash script has a dedicated headless version, rundb_1line_slurm.sh, where user options are hard-coded.

  • Pure python test scripts (test_*.py) are exported/generated from the Jupyter notebooks (test_*.ipynb) to be compatible with batch allocations.

A dedicated dedicated readme covering this topic can be consulted here. The instructions are provided following the templates set by the Colorado University Research Computing User Guide.
